Module kivakit.core
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.value.count

Class BitCount

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.value.count.BaseCount<BitCount>
com.telenav.kivakit.core.value.count.BitCount
All Implemented Interfaces:
Countable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection.NextIterator<BitCount>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.function.Mapper<Long,BitCount>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Arithmetic<BitCount>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Maximizable<BitCount>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Minimizable<BitCount>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Numeric<BitCount>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Zeroable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.string.AsString, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.string.StringFormattable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.value.DoubleValued, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.value.FormattedLongValued, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.value.LongValued, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.value.Source<Long>, Comparable<Countable>, Supplier<Long>
public class BitCount extends BaseCount<BitCount>
A number of bits and various associated methods.

The largest value represented by this number of bits can be retrieved with maximumUnsigned() or maximumSigned() and the smallest by minimumSigned(). A mask for the given number of bits (where a BitCount of 3 would return the mask 111) is given by mask(). Various mathematical operations and conversions can be performed on bit counts, including all such methods in the superclass Count.

Author:
jonathanl
